intro: Capnoides tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan capnoid, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Capnoides tibetica is adapted to cold, arid conditions and is often found in rocky or alpine environments.
